definition: to be of one mind/to think or act alike
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
heart/mind/intention/center/core/CL:顆|颗[ke1],個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: We are all of a mind.
TOM'S mind was made up now.
It seemed as though that mass had become a monster and had but one soul.
sentences.chinese: 那一大队人马仿佛变成了一个怪物，并且只有一条心。

sentences.english: A couple of one mind, mud into gold.
sentences.chinese: 夫妇一条心，泥土变黄金。

sentences.english: No two men are of a mind.
sentences.chinese: 没有两个人是同一条心的。

sentences.english: I only horizontal under a heart, crustily skin of head.
sentences.chinese: 我只有横下一条心，硬着头皮上了。
夫妇一条心，泥土变黄金。

sentences.english: The miners were solid on this issue .
sentences.chinese: 矿工们在这件事上是一条心的。

sentences.english: But such calls for national unity are falling on deaf ears.
sentences.chinese: 但是这种全国一条心的呼吁正进了聋子耳朵。

sentences.english: If we are all concerned only about ourselves we cannot come together with one mind.
sentences.chinese: 如果我们完全考虑自己就不会一条心。

sentences.english: Love is two minds without a single thought.

definition: to twist together to form a rope/(fig.) to unite/to work together
to be of one mind/to work as one
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
(of friends or partners) to share both the honor and the disgrace (idiom)
cross a river in the same boat (idiom); fig. having common interests/obliged to collaborate towards common goals
to work as one (idiom); united in a concerted effort/working hard together
to share joys and sorrows/sharing good times and hard times/same as 同甘共苦
shared delights and common hardships (idiom); to share life's joys and sorrows/for better or for worse
united front
to adopt confrontational posture/to meet head-on/to compete
anger against a common enemy (idiom); joined in opposition to the same adversary
disloyalty/half-heartedness/duplicity
to forget former enmity (idiom)
To enjoy blessings and endure misfortune together (idiom); for better or for worse
pinyin: you3 fu2 tong2 xiang3 , you3 nan4 tong2 dang1

definition: internal strife (family, group, etc)
the two cannot exist together (idiom); irreconcilable differences/incompatible standpoints
